title: McGill Lab: Full AI Project
description: I attended and led weekly seminars to collaboratively study and implement an AI model that aims to simulate higher decision-making capabilities of humans.
I implemented the model in Java & Python versions, with a modular and test-driven approach under hospital-delivery simulation.
I also contributed to the edition of the relevant paper by evaluating and comparing the model with other similar works.
Status: In progress, so it's still closed-source due to lab policy.

title: McGill Lab: Healthy UI - Youtube
description: I co-designed a UI with a theoretical algorithm that aims to moderate the impact brought by extreme video content

The UI combines the traditional tag-based recommendation system with an AI-driven approach to parse user's currently watching video, recommending videos with different perspectives on the same topic. Over 80% subjects voted positively in the survey feedback.
Tech Stack: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, JavaScript, YouTube API, Figma
Status: In progress, so it's still closed-source due to lab policy.

title: McGill Lab: Object Avoidance & Motion Planning
description: In this role, I joined as a research student and explored various algorithms and approachs benefiting modern object avoidance and motion planning in dynamic environment.

My team was supposed to train an AI model using CUDA and PyTorch, but we faced challenges in hardware and time constraints. To deliver the project, I convinced the team to co-implement an optical-flow algorithm with a voting system.
The algorithm was implemented in both Java and Python and integrated with OpenCV. It can give motion recommendations in 8 directions with an accuracy of over 60%.
Status: In progress, so it's still closed-source due to lab policy.
